title: How to display my mobile screen output to a laptop screen - Quora

response.answer_text: Try MobiLock Pro remote control software to share your phone screen with your laptop. It mirrors the active screen of your phone on the laptop in real-time and also you can able to control your phone from the laptop.  With remote control feature, you can : Monitor: It becomes very easy for the Admin to easily monitor the devices as it mirrors its screen on the MobiLock dashboard. Control: It enables access to the registered devices by the admin by which they can have better control over enterprise devices. Support: Remote support can be effortlessly extended to the registered devices as Remote control enables remote access and screen sharing.

The easiest method without rooting your phone, assuming you have Android or iOS, would be to use Mobizen.  There are other softwares and applications out there, but in my experience, Mobizen is the easiest and most reliable.  It'll give you full control of your phone via computer and is pretty easy to use.   Aside from that, there's also TeamViewer, Vysor Chrome app (Android and Chrome), and AirDroid.  Vysor (currently in Beta) worked alright, but again, I've never had reliable experiences with any of those.  Some days I couldn't connect, other days it worked perfectly, and some days it would connect then suddenly disconnect.  But again, these were my experiences, and things tend to change from phone to phone and computer to computer and person to person.
